block.p: Dr. Alysa Emily Doyle, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William A. Doyle of Manhattan, was married last evening in Cambridge, Mass., to Dr. Christopher Rees Smith, the son of Dr. and Mrs. Frank Rees Smith of Houston. The Rev. Dr. Edwin H. Cassem, a Roman Catholic priest and professor of psychiatry at Harvard Medical School, performed the ceremony in the Memorial Church at Harvard.

Dr. Doyle, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of neuropsychology in the pediatric psychopharmacology clinic at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. She graduated from Williams College and received a Ph.D. in child and adult clinical psychology from the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis. Her father, now retired, was an operations specialist in Brooklyn with the check-processing department of the Chase Manhattan Bank. Her mother, Barbara Doyle, writes romance novels.

Dr. Alysa Emily Doyle, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William A. Doyle of Manhattan, was married last evening in Cambridge, Mass., to Dr. Christopher Rees Smith, the son of Dr. and Mrs. Frank Rees Smith of Houston. The Rev. Dr. Edwin H. Cassem, a Roman Catholic priest and professor of psychiatry at Harvard Medical School, performed the ceremony in the Memorial Church at Harvard.

Dr. Doyle, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of neuropsychology in the pediatric psychopharmacology clinic at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. She graduated from Williams College and received a Ph.D. in child and adult clinical psychology from the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis. Her father, now retired, was an operations specialist in Brooklyn with the check-processing department of the Chase Manhattan Bank. Her mother, Barbara Doyle, writes romance novels.

Dr. Smith, who is 35 and an internist, works in Boston as the associate medical director of ChannelHealth Inc., a company that designs and makes computer software for medical offices. He graduated from Yale University and the Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons. His mother, Gwynneth Smith, retired as the president of the Houston chapter of Planned Parenthood. His father, an internist, retired as the senior scientific adviser to the United States division of Exxon.
